definitions.definition: To grant, give, admit, accord, afford, or yield; to let one have.
definitions.example: to allow a servant his liberty;  to allow a free passage;  to allow one day for rest

definitions.definition: To acknowledge; to accept as true; to concede; to accede to an opinion.
definitions.example: to allow a right;  to allow a claim;  to allow the truth of a proposition

definitions.definition: To grant (something) as a deduction or an addition; especially to abate or deduct.
definitions.example: To allow a sum for leakage.

definitions.definition: To grant license to; to permit; to consent to.
definitions.example: Smoking allowed only in designated areas.
Although I don't consent to their holding such meetings, I will allow them for the time being.

definitions.definition: To take into account by making an allowance.
definitions.example: When calculating a budget for a construction project, always allow for contingencies.

definitions.definition: To praise; to approve of; hence, to sanction.
To sanction; to invest; to entrust.
To like; to be suited or pleased with.
